text: "Mimi" is a popular song written by Richard Rodgers, with words by Lorenz Hart. It was featured in the movie Love Me Tonight (1932), in which it was first sung by Maurice Chevalier to Jeanette MacDonald, then later reprised by the entire company. Sergio Franchi performed this song January 2, 1964 on the ABC Television special, Victor Borge At Carnegie Hall.New York Times, January 3, 1964, Jack Gould, "When The Pianist and Gag Writer Meet," New York City Sergio Franchi also recorded "Mimi" on his 1963 RCA Victor Red Seal album. Women In My Life. Sergio Franchi ==References== Category:Songs with music by Richard Rodgers Category:Songs with lyrics by Lorenz Hart Category:1932 songs Category:Maurice Chevalier songs
title: Mimi (song)
